              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants.               208. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2a.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short皮膚狀況。[應填入以下字串之一：正常 | 異常]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              210. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2a.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              212. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2a.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）

              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))

              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              254. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2c.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value請問皮膚異常的狀況為何？
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              256. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2c.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..*
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              258. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2c.answer.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              260. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2c.answer.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              262. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2c.answer.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              264. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2c.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short皮膚異常的狀況。[應填入以下字串之一：乾燥有皮屑 | 瘀青 | 丘疹 | 傷口 | 疥瘡]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              266. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2c.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              268. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2c.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              270. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d
              Slice Nameitem-G2d
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG2d. 傷口情形
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control0..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              272. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse

              278. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG2d
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              280. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              320. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d1.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short壓傷等級。[應填入以下字串之一：第一級 | 第二級 | 第三級 | 第四級 | 無法分級 | 深層組織損傷]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              322. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d1.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              324. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d1.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              326. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d2
              Slice Nameitem-G2d2
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG2d2. 何者有壓傷或傷口
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control0..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              328. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d2.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              330. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d2.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              332. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d2.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              334. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d2.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG2d2
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              336. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d2.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              338. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d2.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value何者有壓傷或傷口
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              340. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G2d2.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..*
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              388. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              390. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG3b
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              392. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              394. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value受限制的位置
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              396. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..*
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              398. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.answer.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              400. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.answer.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              402. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.answer.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              404. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short受限制的位置。[應填入以下字串之一：肩關節 | 肘關節 | 腕指關節 | 髖關節 | 膝關節 | 踝關節 | 頸關節 | 全身關節]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              406. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              408. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G3b.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              410. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4a
              Slice Nameitem-G4a
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG4a. 個案過去 3 個月體重是否減輕？
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())

              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse

              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value個案身體質量指數（BMI）
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              452. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4b.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              454. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4b.answer.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              456. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4b.answer.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              458. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4b.answer.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              460. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4b.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short請依照顧管理評估量表 G4b.個案身體質量指數（BMI）之欄位填答。
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              462. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4b.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              464. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4b.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              466. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4c
              Slice Nameitem-G4c
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG4c. 個案一般的飲食狀況，以週為單位
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              468. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4c.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.

              474. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4c.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG4c
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              476. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4c.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              478. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4c.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse

              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short個案一般的飲食狀況，以週為單位。[應填入以下字串之一：未吃完，每餐進食量不超過整餐的 1/3，或除正餐外沒有補充任何點心，或被禁食（或採清流質或靜脈輸液超過 5 天），或灌食自製管灌飲食小於 1600c.c./日，或攝取的管灌飲食小於 800 大卡/日 | 未吃完，每餐進食量不超過整餐的 1/2，或偶爾吃點心，或灌食自製管灌飲食小於 2000c.c./日，或攝取的管灌飲食小於 1000 大卡/日 | 未吃完，每餐進食量超過整餐的 1/2，或有時拒絕用餐但會吃點心，或灌食自製管灌飲食小於 2400c.c./日，或攝取的管灌飲食小於 1200 大卡/日 | 每餐吃完，從不拒絕用餐，或不需任何補充食物，或灌食自製管灌飲食大於 2400c.c./日，或採用管灌飲食（或靜脈營養）大於 1200 大卡/日]
              Comments

              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              516. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d1.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short過去一年中體重減少了 5% 以上？[應填入以下字串之一：是 | 否 | 其他：（請說明）]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              518. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d1.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              520. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d1.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              522. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d2
              Slice Nameitem-G4d2
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG4d2. 可以在不用手支撐的狀況下，從椅子上站起來 5 次？
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              524. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d2.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              526. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d2.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              528. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d2.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              530. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d2.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG4d2
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              532. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d2.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              534. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d2.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value可以在不用手支撐的狀況下，從椅子上站起來 5 次？
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              536. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4d2.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              584. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              586. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG4e
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              588. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              590. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value請問個案是否有經醫師診斷，且目前（6 個月內）仍存在的疾病
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              592. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..*
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Example<br/><b>Value</b>:否 | 是，高血壓，目前正在治療、目前使用藥物
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              594. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.answer.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              596. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.answer.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element.               ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              598. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.answer.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.               Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.               Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers

              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              600. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short回覆的內容。[應填入回覆的內容]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              602. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              604. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4e.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              606. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4f
              Slice Nameitem-G4f
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG4f. 個案尋求必要醫療時，是否需要服務介入協助？
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              608. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G4f.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
