              Pattern Value個案目前是否接受進階照顧？
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              648. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              650. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a.answer.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              652. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a.answer.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              654. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a.answer.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              656. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short個案目前是否接受進階照顧？[應填入以下字串之一：無 | 有]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              658. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              660. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              662. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a1
              Slice Nameitem-G5a1
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG5a1. 進階照顧的內容
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control0..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              664. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a1.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse

              670. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a1.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG5a1
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              672. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a1.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              674. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G5a1.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value進階照顧的內容
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))

This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              712. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6a.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short個案是否有任何關於吞嚥困難的情形或症狀？[應填入以下字串之一：無吞嚥困難 | 抱怨吞嚥困難或吞嚥時會疼痛 | 吃東西或喝水的時候出現咳嗽或嗆咳 | 用餐後嘴中仍含著食物或留有殘餘食物 | 當喝或吃流質或固質的食物時，食物會從嘴角邊流失 | 有流口水之情形 | 無法評估]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              714. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6a.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              716. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6a.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              718. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6b
              Slice Nameitem-G6b
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG6b. 個案有無接受過吞嚥訓練？
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control0..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              720. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6b.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              722. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6b.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              724. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6b.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              726. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6b.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG6b
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              728. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6b.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              730. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6b.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value個案有無接受過吞嚥訓練？
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              732. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G6b.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))

              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              780. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              782. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG8a
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              784. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              786. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value請問個案是否能維持坐姿的平衡？（在沒有靠背支撐的狀況下）
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              788. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              790. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.answer.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              792. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.answer.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              794. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.answer.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.               Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              796. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short請問個案是否能維持坐姿的平衡？[應填入以下字串之一：正常，不靠扶持能坐著達一分鐘以上 | 較差，不靠扶持只能坐著十秒鐘至一分鐘 | 極差，不靠扶持只能坐著少於十秒鐘（包括完全無法坐）]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              798. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              800. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8a.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              802. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8b
              Slice Nameitem-G8b
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG8b. 請問個案是否能維持站立的平衡？
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              804. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8b.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              842. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value在過去 12 個月中，個案有沒有跌倒或摔倒過？
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              844. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              846. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c.answer.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              848. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c.answer.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              850. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c.answer.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              852. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short在過去 12 個月中，個案有沒有跌倒或摔倒過？[應填入以下字串之一：沒有跌倒或摔倒過【跳答 G8d】 | 跌倒或摔倒 1 次【續答 G8c1】 | 跌倒或摔倒 2 次以上（含 2 次）【續答 G8c1】]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              854. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              856. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              858. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c1
              Slice Nameitem-G8c1
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG8c1. 現在移位或走路時是否異常
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control0..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              860. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c1.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse

              866. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c1.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG8c1
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              868. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8c1.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))

              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value現在移位或走路時是否異常（指是否有困難）例如：頭暈、不穩或不安全

              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short你的日常活動是否因擔心跌倒而不做？[應填入以下字串之一：不會擔心 | 會擔心 | 不適用（坐輪椅者、臥床者）]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              910. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8d.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              912. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8d.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              914. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e
              Slice Nameitem-G8e
              Definition

              A group or question item from the original questionnaire for which answers are provided.

              ShortG8e. 個案對於危險的認知？
              Comments

              Groups cannot have answers and therefore must nest directly within item. When dealing with questions, nesting must occur within each answer because some questions may have multiple answers (and the nesting occurs for each answer).

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              qrs-1: Nested item can't be beneath both item and answer ((answer.exists() and item.exists()).not())
              916. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              918. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              920. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              922. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.linkId
              Definition

              The item from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this item in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.

              Short問題或量表項目的唯一識別碼。[應填入獨立的編號]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Items can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence by position might not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

              Pattern ValueG8e
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              924. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.definition
              Definition

              A reference to an ElementDefinition that provides the details for the item.

              ShortElementDefinition - details for the item
              Comments

              The ElementDefinition must be in a StructureDefinition, and must have a fragment identifier that identifies the specific data element by its id (Element.id). E.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Observation#Observation.value[x].

              There is no need for this element if the item pointed to by the linkId has a definition listed.

              Control0..1
              Typeuri
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              A common pattern is to define a set of data elements, and then build multiple different questionnaires for different circumstances to gather the data. This element provides traceability to the common definition.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              926. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.text
              Definition

              Text that is displayed above the contents of the group or as the text of the question being answered.

              Short問題或量表項目的內容描述。[應填入問題或量表項目的內容]
              Control1..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Allows the questionnaire response to be read without access to the questionnaire.

              Pattern Value個案對於危險的認知？
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              928. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.answer
              Definition

              The respondent's answer(s) to the question.

              Short問題或量表項目的回覆
              Comments

              The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

              Control1..1
              TypeBackboneElement
              Is Modifierfalse
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              930. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.answer.id
              Definition

              Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

              ShortUnique id for inter-element referencing
              Control0..1
              Typestring
              Is Modifierfalse
              XML FormatIn the XML format, this property is represented as an attribute.
              Summaryfalse
              932. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.answer.extension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

              ShortAdditional content defined by implementations
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse
              Alternate Namesextensions, user content
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              934. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.answer.modifierExtension
              Definition

              May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

              Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

              ShortExtensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
              Comments

              There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

              Control0..*
              TypeExtension
              Is Modifiertrue because Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
              Summarytrue
              Requirements

              Modifier extensions allow for extensions that cannot be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the definition of modifier extensions.

              Alternate Namesextensions, user content, modifiers
              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              ext-1: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both (extension.exists() != value.exists())
              936. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.answer.value[x]
              Definition

              The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.

              Short個案對於危險的認知？[應填入以下字串之一：有能力：可以認識日常生活危險來源 | 大部分有能力：可以認識大部分於日常生活中的危險來源 | 小範圍有能力：對於常會碰到的危險（尤其是住家環境中會出現的危險），卻常不認為那是危險 | 無能力：完全不自知有危險]
              Comments

              More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type. Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions. Must match the datatype specified by Questionnaire.item.type in the corresponding Questionnaire.

              Control1..1
              BindingFor example codes, see QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
              (example to http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/questionnaire-answers)

              Code indicating the response provided for a question.

              Typestring
              [x] NoteSeeChoice of Data Typesfor further information about how to use [x]
              Is Modifierfalse
              Primitive ValueThis primitive element may be present, or absent, or replaced by an extension
              Must Supporttrue
              Summaryfalse
              Requirements

              Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

              Invariantsele-1: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children (hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()))
              938. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.answer.item
              Definition

              Nested groups and/or questions found within this particular answer.

              ShortNested groups and questions
              Control0..*
              TypeSeettp://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/QuestionnaireResponse#QuestionnaireResponse.item
              Is Modifierfalse
              Summaryfalse

              It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

              940. QuestionnaireResponse.item:item-G8e.item
              Definition

              Questions or sub-groups nested beneath a question or group.

              Short問卷的問題或量表項目（用於巢狀問卷）
